intro: Hesperis petraea, commonly known as the rock hyssop, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, appearing in clusters at the end of the stems. Hesperis petraea is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
